column4: i might not have been clear, i manually installed apache 1.3(no apt) the aptitude purge command did not uninstall it
what else could i try?
well actually
here is the problem
i installed apache on accident with the zend IDE and now whenever i goto localhost apache 1.3 is used instead of apache 2 which i already had installed.
I just want to delete it.
should i delete all of the directories that are called apache?
how can i log in as root so i dont have to do the deleting via the console?
giving root a pass is 'sudo -s -sH' correct?

i have been attempting to manually remove the apache 1.3 server from my machine and have successfullt removed nearly every file except for the icons and am wonder why when i goto localhost in my browser it still comes up as apache but without the fancy page, just an error. How can i get this demon of an apache web server off my machine?
apache is probably still loaded in memory, /etc/init.d/(service) stop
/etc/init.d/apache(tab) stop
must have gotten removed
sudo killall apache
best to use "apt-get --purge remove app" to get rid of stuff you no longer want installed
what command are you passing to firefox ?
what port I guess I am asking
do top and see if you can see any apache related processes running
try clearing your browser cache
re-install apache then apt-get --purge remove apache
other than that I don't know what to tell you :P
